title: Rebinds defs for sc and sqlContext
TOREE-284 add support for custom SQL context class
body:
**Today** Toree defines a SQL context object by first trying to load "org.apache.spark.sql.hive.HiveContext" using reflection. If it fails, it falls back to SQLContext.

**My usecase** I have a custom SQL context class, which I want toree to load by reading from a custom spark configuration property (spark.sql.context.class)

title: Fixed issue with rebinding defs into vals
body: While working on #15, found out that `def` where getting redefined as `val` after doing an `%addJar`. This PR filters out Symbols that are `sourceMethods`.

title: [TOREE 277]: Added tutorial notebook for magics
body: This notebook should be left with the output so users can view the documentation properly in places like github and nbviewer.

title: Upgrading references to Spark to 1.6.1
body: Addresses https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-267

title: Removing --spark-configuration cmd arg
body: fixed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-219

title: Converted magics to plugins
body:
Fixed plugin test classpath to run script

Updated internal plugin loading to use only Toree-related classes

Updated compilation to use Java 1.6 to avoid issues on JDK 8

Fixed kernel hanging on shutdown

title: [TOREE-282] Remove `Created by` comments from source code
body: ASF strongly recommends to remove @author tags and `created by` because they imply individual ownership. We had better remove them if possible.

title: Adding support for sharing sqlContext across interpreters
body: Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-166

title: Modified dev target to use docker and allow JVM debugger
body: Now we can use `make dev` with docker to run toree without `pip install` and with support for JVM debug

title: Prep for release to maven
body:
This fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-245.

This PR contains modifications to build to release JAR artifacts of Toree.
- [x] Fix POM of root project
- [x] Signing of release packages for download (http://blog.sonatype.com/2010/01/how-to-generate-pgp-signatures-with-maven/#.Vm9Km8q22-q)
- [x] Signing of JARs published to maven (http://blog.sonatype.com/2010/01/how-to-generate-pgp-signatures-with-maven/#.Vm9Km8q22-q)
- [x] Run rat
- [x] Build src, bin, jdoc for submodules to publish on maven
- [x] Build assembly used in pip distro
- [x] Publish to local maven to test
- [x] Publish to apache staging to test
- [x] Package Notice/Licence files in all JARS
- [x] Package Notice/Licence file in bin distro
- [x] Package Notice/Licence file in pip distro
- [x] Build comprehensive Notice/License file for bin/pip/assembly packages
- [x] Automate using Travis? (not possible to fully automate... will need to look at Jenkins)
- [x] Add disclaimer to release packages (not including JARS) (http://incubator.apache.org/guides/branding.html#disclaimers)
- [x] Rename bin package to contain the name 'incubating'
- [x] Any additional disclaimer due to LGPL dependency
- [x] Create a source distribution. Based on http://www.apache.org/dev/release-publishing.html#valid
- [x] Validate that we can publish to real maven repo
- [x] Rename referent to toree kernel in notebook to Apache Toree
- [x] Release notes

title: Adding binder support to simplify consumption of examples and play wi
body:
This adds support to run our repo as a Binder in mybinder.org.

To see how this works, go to https://github.com/lbustelo/incubator-toree and click `Binder` badge in the README or go to http://mybinder.org/repo/lbustelo/incubator-toree.

title: [TOREE 256]: Add installation of all interpreters via pip.
body:
Enables all interpreters to be installed by default. Users can specify the interpreters they want by providing a comma seperated list:

```
toree install --interpreters=PySpark,SQL
```

title: [WIP] Add scala 2.11.7 support
body:
Work in progress.

Got Toree client/kernel to compile under 2.11.7, not including tests.
Compiling via `sbt ++2.11.7 compile`.
Will update makefile once 2.11.7 fully works.

Some notes:
1. Changes in REPL class server (no longer used, now using RpcEnv, same HTTP server as SparkContext?)
   - https://github.com/apache/spark/commit/4a46b8859d3314b5b45a67cdc5c81fecb6e9e78c
   - This is for Spark 2.0, not 1.6+
2. Most of Spark-specific REPL classes are gone (now serializable friendly)
   - https://github.com/apache/spark/commit/11e22b74a080ea58fb9410b5cc6fa4c03f9198f2
3. Scala 2.11 fix to allow dynamic add jar
   - https://github.com/scala/scala/pull/4051

I've already applied the Scala 2.11 fix to let us keep addJar/addDeps, although I still think we need to add the lazy interpreter to Scala so we can add jars to the compiler classpath before it starts. That requires magics to not be evaluated inside the interpreter. Discussed this with Justin last year.

Have not yet tackled issues with REPL class server settings (no longer created inside interpreter). Not sure of the ramifications of Spark-specific REPL classes being gone. Assuming we can just use the stock IMain (which is what I did) since it is serializable-friendly.

Things to point out:
1. Have specific 2.10/2.11 implementation of magic class creation since it uses Scala reflection, which changed a little bit
   - This should go away once we switch to the plugin system since it uses Java reflection
2. Have specific 2.10/2.11 implementation of parts of Scala interpreter that use SparkIMain versus IMain
   - We need to clean up the interpreter interface as it has methods that do not make sense like getting the class server uri

title: Updated to use coursier for dependency resolution/downloading
body: Switches dependency resolution/downloading from sbt's default to coursier (what we use for %AddDeps). Much faster, can run in parallel, can work offline using cache (sbt fails often if not online), more easily sandbox dependencies between projects, no global locks (waiting on ~/.ivy2/.sbt.ivy.lock), blah blah blah.

title: Added initial plugin implementation
body: Adds a plugin module (unit and integration tests added). @lbustelo @Lull3rSkat3r we should talk about what to do with this.

title: Added functions to send rich display content to client
body: This PR adds a couple of functions to the `kernel` object to enable sending rich content to the client. For now it is supporting HTML and Javascript, but also has a generic method to send content of any mime-type that the client can handle.

title: Meetup Streaming Demo
body:
This PR adds a streaming demo that is based on https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/dashboards/blob/master/etc/notebooks/stream_demo/meetup-streaming.ipynb but using Scala as the language.

This demo also uses https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/declarativewidgets and https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/dashboards.

title: [WIP] Meetup Streaming Demo
body:
This PR adds a streaming demo that is based on https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/dashboards/blob/master/etc/notebooks/stream_demo/meetup-streaming.ipynb but using Scala as the language.

This demo also uses https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/declarativewidgets and https://github.com/jupyter-incubator/dashboards.

title: Update dependency downloader
body:
Adds the following options to %AddDeps:
- `--repository <URL>` to include another repository when downloading
- `--trace` to print out download information
- `--verbose` to print out miscellaneous information

``` scala
%AddDeps org.apache.spark spark-streaming-mqtt_2.10 1.5.2 --trace --transitive --repository https://extra-repo.com
```

These options will show up in the help menu. You can provide `--repository` more than once to include more than one additional repository.

Will ignore any malformed URL. Will try repositories provided by `--repository` first before default repositories.

title: Updated client artifact name from 'client' to 'toree-client'
[TOREE 249] Enable pip install
body:
This commit enables the building, packaging and release of a pip package.
The package can be installed via `pip install toree`. This then enables the
kernel installation via `jupyter toree install`.

title: Apache and Project name changes
body:
Collection of changes due to new home and rename
- [x] Update project module names (for publishing to maven central)
- [x] Update project version
- [x] Update package names to be org.apache.toree
- [x] Update docs to reflect the name toree and update code samples to use new
  namespaces
- [x] Update license headers to remove any spark kernel/IBM references
